title: Regina  Lisinker
text:
I am a graduate student and passionate statistics educator. I have experience teaching introductory courses and workshops in regression, simulation, hypothesis and significance testing, and data visualization. I have taught students to use a number of softwares, such as R, JMP, and TinkerPlots. My research interests revolve around how students learn statistics and data science, with particular focus on communication within classrooms and communication with data (e.g. code review, pair programming, data visualization).
I am an avid Pinterest user, I love karaoke, and I stop to pet every dog I pass (after asking their owner, of course).

title: About
text:
Bio
I am a PhD student at the University of Minnesota - Twin Cities studying Psychological Foundations in Education with a research focus on Statistics and Data Science Education through the Educational Psychology department. I earned my Master of Arts degree in Educational Psychology (Quantitative Methods in Education with an emphasis on Statistics Education) also from the University of Minnesota - Twin Cities. I earned my Bachelor of Science degree in Statistics with a Gerontology minor at California Polytechnic State University San Luis Obispo.
I am a passionate statistics educator and have experience teaching introductory courses and workshops in regression, simulation, hypothesis and significance testing, and data visualization. I have taught students to use a number of softwares, such as R, JMP, and TinkerPlots.


Education
Ph.D. Educational Psychology with a focus on Statistics Education September 2023 - present
Psychological Foundations in Education University of Minnesota, Twin Cities
M.A. Educational Psychology with a focus on Statistics Education September 2021 - October 2023
Quantitative Methods in Education University of Minnesota, Twin Cities
B.S. Statistics September 2016 - June 2020
Minor in Gerontology California Polytechnic State University, San Luis Obispo
